item.title: Is a library the same thing as a package?
item.description: In R you use the library() function to load a package. Thus, surely a package and a library must be the same thing, right? Actually no, they are not! So, what’s the difference between the two? A library is nothing but a folder on your computer in which installed packages are saved. Just like a real library that contains books. It is merely a container. A library on its own is useless.
